content.question: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. The continuous function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is defined on the closed interval <math alttext="negative 6 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The figure above shows a portion of the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, consisting of two line segments and a quarter of a circle centered at the point <math alttext="with coordinates, 5 comma 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. It is known that the point <math alttext="with coordinates, 3 comma, 3 minus the square root of 5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is on the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. a) If <math alttext="the integral from, negative 6 to 5, of, f of x, d x, equals 7" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></math>, find the value of <math alttext="the integral from, negative 6 to negative 2, of, f of x, d x" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>. Show the work that leads to your answer.

frqParts.text: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. The continuous function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is defined on the closed interval <math alttext="negative 6 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The figure above shows a portion of the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, consisting of two line segments and a quarter of a circle centered at the point <math alttext="with coordinates, 5 comma 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. It is known that the point <math alttext="with coordinates, 3 comma, 3 minus the square root of 5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is on the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. a) If <math alttext="the integral from, negative 6 to 5, of, f of x, d x, equals 7" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></math>, find the value of <math alttext="the integral from, negative 6 to negative 2, of, f of x, d x" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>. Show the work that leads to your answer.

b) Evaluate <math alttext="the integral from, 3 to 5, of open parenthesis, 2 times f prime of x, plus 4, close parenthesis, d x" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>.

c) The function <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="g of x, equals, the integral from, negative 2 to x, of, f of t, d t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. Find the absolute maximum value of <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="negative 2 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Justify your answer.

d) Find <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 1, of the fraction with numerator 10 to the x power, minus, 3 times f prime of x, and denominator f of x, minus, arc tangent x, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>arctan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 1.5: Determining Limits Using Algebraic Properties of Limits

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
